title: Play Store Deployment Quiz
description: Test your understanding of the Google Play Store deployment process for KMP Android apps.

questions.text: What file format does Google Play require for new app submissions (since August 2021)?
questions.explanation: Google Play requires Android App Bundle (.aab) format for all new apps. AABs allow Google Play to generate optimized APKs for each device configuration (screen density, CPU architecture, language), reducing download size by 15-30% compared to universal APKs.

questions.text: What is the purpose of Play App Signing?
options: To encrypt the app's source code
Google manages your app signing key, so you upload with an upload key and Google re-signs for distribution
To verify the developer's identity via government ID
To password-protect the app from unauthorized users
questions.explanation: Play App Signing means Google holds your app signing key securely. You sign uploads with a separate upload key. If your upload key is compromised, you can reset it without affecting existing installs. Google re-signs the final APKs with the app signing key.

questions.text: What is the recommended testing track progression before production release?
options: Internal testing -> Closed testing -> Open testing -> Production
questions.explanation: The recommended progression is: Internal testing (up to 100 testers, instant approval) -> Closed testing (invited testers, can require review) -> Open testing (anyone can join, full review) -> Production. Each stage catches different categories of issues.
